name: Birmingham City FC History Quiz | Birmingham City | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the original name of Birmingham City?
questions.explanation:
Small Heath Alliance.

	The club was named Small Heath Alliance until 1905, when they became known as Birmingham Football Club. After that, the legend was born.

questions.text: What year was the club that became known as Birmingham City formed?
questions.explanation:
1875.

	Small Heath Alliance were formed in 1875, by a bunch of cricketers from the Holy Church in Bordesley Green.

questions.text: Which of these grounds have Birmingham City under any name, not called their home for a full season?
questions.explanation:
Villa Park.

	The club played at Arthur Street between 1874-77, before moving to Muntz Street for 19 years, until they made St. Andrews their home. Villa Park is the home of rivals Aston Villa.

questions.text: Who was the clubs first manager?
questions.explanation:
Alfred Jones.

	Alfred Jones managed the club for 18 years between 1892-1908. Over the years, Birmingham have had a few famous names as manager, including Ron Saunders, Lou Macari, Barry Fry and Trevor Francis.

questions.text: When did Birmingham City first reach the FA Cup final?
questions.explanation:
1931.

	Birmingham reached the final but were beaten 2-1 by West Bromwich Albion. They only reached the final once more in the 20th century, and were again beaten, this time 3-1 by Manchester City.

questions.text: Which of the following played the most games for the club?
questions.explanation:
Gil Merrick.

	Merrick played 551 games between 1938-60.

questions.text: Which of the follwoing did NOT score 5 goals in a game for the club?
questions.explanation:
Will Devey.

	Will Devey actually scored 6 in one game, against Nottingham Forest in a 12-0 win on March 8, 1890.

questions.text: How many goals did Trevor Francis score for Birmingham?
questions.explanation:
134.

	Trevor Francis scored 134 goals in 330 games between 1969-79, and also managed the club between 1996-2001.

questions.text: In which season did Birmingham first win the second division under this name?
questions.explanation:
1920-21.

	Small Heath won the second division in 1892-93, but weren't promoted as they lost out to Sheffield United and Darwen, in a three way play-off to see who would be promoted. It would take them a further 28 years before they were promoted along with Cardiff City.

questions.text: What year were Birmingham promoted to the Premiership for the first time?
questions.explanation:
2002.

	The club finished 5th in Division One, but were promoted via the play-offs after first beating Millwall, in a two-legged tie 2-1 on aggregate, and defeated Norwich City in the final 4-2 on penalties after a 1-1 draw.
